Package edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre

Class Problem

java.lang.Object
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.Problem
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
CompiledProblem
public class Problem extends Object implements Serializable
Represents all the definitions needed to define a full planning task. A problem defines:
  • a name
  • a list of types and entities defined in a universe
  • a list of fluents
  • a list of events, as well as smaller lists of actions and triggers
  • a logical expression defining the initial state
  • an author utility
  • a character utility for each character
Problem objects usually should not be constructed directly. They should be defined using a ProblemBuilder to ensure correct formatting.

The fluents and events defined in a problem can be templates, meaning their signatures contain variables. A fluent or event template implicitly defines all possible ground versions of that template. Every ground fluent or event must have a unique signature; A problem builder enforces this by preventing two templates from ambiguously defining two ground objects that would be different but have the same signature.

Author:
Stephen G. Ware

  • Method Details

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

    • getFluent

      public Fluent getFluent(Signature signature)
      Returns a fluent defined in this problem based on the given signature. The signature does not need to match a fluent explicitly defined in this problem; it can match a fluent implicitly defined by a template. Any types and entities in the signature will be replaced with types and entities of the same name in this problem's universe, if they exist.
      Parameters:
      signature - the signature of the fluent to find
      Returns:
      the defined fluent
      Throws:
      FormatException - if no fluent matching this signature is defined

    • getEvent

      public Event getEvent(Signature signature)
      Returns an event defined in this problem based on the given signature. The signature does not need to match an event explicitly defined in this problem; it can match an event implicitly defined by a template. Any types and entities in the signature will be replaced with types and entities of the same name in this problem's universe, if they exist.
      Parameters:
      signature - the signature of the event to find
      Returns:
      the defined event
      Throws:
      FormatException - if no event matching this signature is defined

    • getAction

      public Action getAction(Signature signature)

The signature does not need to match an action explicitly defined in this problem; it can match an action implicitly defined by a template. Any types and entities in the signature will be replaced with types and entities of the same name in this problem's universe, if they exist.
      Parameters:

      the defined action
      Throws:

    • getTrigger

      public Trigger getTrigger(Signature signature)
      Returns a trigger defined in this problem based on the given signature. The signature does not need to match a trigger explicitly defined in this problem; it can match an action implicitly defined by a template. Any types and entities in the signature will be replaced with types and entities of the same name in this problem's universe, if they exist.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the defined trigger
      Throws:

    • getUtility

      public Value getUtility(Character character, State state)
      Returns the value of a character's utility expression in a given state.
      Parameters:

      state - the state in which to evaluate the character's utility
      Returns:
      the character's utility in that state
